item.title: [PI]Bank? HELP![PI]
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

Yeah, let’s say they were in the area I wanted them NOT to be able to open up the bank. They would get a message saying “You can’t bank WHEREVER”).

When I type ‘::bank’ in the Wilderness, I get the message (“You can’t bank in the Wilderness”). I want it to do that for the other areas I need without having to remove the ‘::bank’ command entirely from regular players.

Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Bank? HELP![PI]
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

Hello, I’ve got another problem:/!

I don’t know how to declare that they can’t open the bank.

public boolean inMainR() { if (absX > 2223 && absX < 2232 && absY > 4959 && absY < 4952) { return true; } return false; }

I’ll use that as the example, how do I declare in that boolean that they can’t open up the bank if they’re in that area. The same as inWild, however I can’t seem to find where it’s declared in inWild.

Thanks!

Read full topic
